desc:
Mini-batch Sparse Principal Components Analysis
Finds the set of sparse components that can optimally reconstruct
the data. The amount of sparseness is controllable by the coefficient
of the L1 penalty, given by the parameter alpha.
Read more in the User Guide.

params.name: n_components
params.desc: number of sparse atoms to extract

params.name: alpha
params.desc: Sparsity controlling parameter. Higher values lead to sparser components.

params.name: ridge_alpha
params.desc: Amount of ridge shrinkage to apply in order to improve conditioning when calling the transform method.

params.name: n_iter
params.desc: number of iterations to perform for each mini batch

params.name: callback
params.desc: callable that gets invoked every five iterations

params.name: batch_size
params.desc: the number of features to take in each mini batch

params.name: verbose
params.desc: Controls the verbosity; the higher, the more messages. Defaults to 0.

params.name: shuffle
params.desc: whether to shuffle the data before splitting it in batches

params.name: n_jobs
params.desc: number of parallel jobs to run, or -1 to autodetect.

params.name: method
params.desc: lars: uses the least angle regression method to solve the lasso problem (linear_model.lars_path) cd: uses the coordinate descent method to compute the Lasso solution (linear_model.Lasso). Lars will be faster if the estimated components are sparse.

params.name: random_state
params.type: int, RandomState instance or None, optional (default=None)
params.desc: If int, random_state is the seed used by the random number generator; If RandomState instance, random_state is the random number generator; If None, the random number generator is the RandomState instance used by np.random.

attrs.name: components_
attrs.desc: Sparse components extracted from the data.

attrs.name: error_
attrs.desc: Vector of errors at each iteration.
